含义: The character '今' means 'now' or 'today'. It refers to the present time or the current moment.
字形: The character '今' is composed of two parts: the top part is a short horizontal stroke, and the bottom part resembles a hook or a curve. It is a simple character with only 4 strokes.
读音: The pronunciation of '今' is 'jīn' in Mandarin Chinese, with the first tone (high and level).
字源: The character '今' originated from ancient pictographs. In its earliest form, it depicted a person holding a staff, symbolizing the present moment. Over time, it evolved into its current simplified form.
同音字: 斤 (jīn, catty, a unit of weight)
成语: 今非昔比 (jīn fēi xī bǐ, the present cannot compare to the past)
古往今来 (gǔ wǎng jīn lái, from ancient times to the present)
今朝有酒今朝醉 (jīn zhāo yǒu jiǔ jīn zhāo zuì, enjoy the present moment)
今是昨非 (jīn shì zuó fēi, today is right, yesterday was wrong)
例句: 今天天气很好。 (Jīntiān tiānqì hěn hǎo. The weather is nice today.)
今非昔比，我们的生活越来越好了。 (Jīn fēi xī bǐ, wǒmen de shēnghuó yuè lái yuè hǎo le. Times have changed, and our lives are getting better.)
今朝有酒今朝醉，明日愁来明日愁。 (Jīn zhāo yǒu jiǔ jīn zhāo zuì, míngrì chóu lái míngrì chóu. Enjoy the present moment, and worry about tomorrow when it comes.)
短故事: In ancient China, a scholar named Li Bai wrote a famous poem about living in the moment. He used the phrase '今朝有酒今朝醉' to encourage people to enjoy the present rather than worrying about the future. This phrase has since become a popular saying in Chinese culture.

Another story involves a farmer who always complained about his life. One day, a wise man told him, '今非昔比' (the present cannot compare to the past). The farmer realized that he should appreciate the present and stop longing for the past.
诗词: 《静夜思》 - 李白 (Jìng yè sī - Lǐ Bái): '床前明月光，疑是地上霜。举头望明月，低头思故乡。' (The moonlight shines before my bed, like frost on the ground. I raise my head to gaze at the moon, and lower it to think of home.)

《将进酒》 - 李白 (Qiāng jìn jiǔ - Lǐ Bái): '人生得意须尽欢，莫使金樽空对月。天生我材必有用，千金散尽还复来。' (When life is good, enjoy it to the fullest, and don't let the golden cup sit empty under the moon. Heaven has given me talents that will surely be useful, and even if I spend all my wealth, it will return.)
